user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of check_param__connections:
```c
static int
check_param__connections (void)
{
  if (0 == tool_params.connections)
    return ! 0;
  if (get_num_threads () > tool_params.connections)
  {
    fprintf (stderr, "The connections number limit (%u) is less than number "
             "of threads used (%u). Use higher value for connections limit.\n",
             tool_params.connections, get_num_threads ());
    return 0;
  }
  return ! 0;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
if (get_num_threads () > tool_params.connections)
  {
    fprintf (stderr, "The connections number limit (%u) is less than number "
             "of threads used (%u). Use higher value for connections limit.\n",
             tool_params.connections, get_num_threads ());
    return 0;
  }
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation — the if-block (fprintf + return 0) is reachable when get_num_threads() > tool_params.connections; otherwise execution falls through to the final return. There is no code that can never be executed (calls to get_num_threads() may occur twice but do not make code unreachable).
